<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Monday morning. </strong>The coronavirus has obliterated many things about normal life, one of which is the concept of having “things to do.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the collective sanity of everyone confined to their homes, we're going to include a Daily Planner section at the bottom of the newsletter. Down there, you’ll find home workouts, events happening in cyberspace, evening activities, and more—all curated with love by the Brew writers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's clear we are going to be living like this for a while, so we might as well get good at it. </p>

<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. economy: </strong></span><span>We are looking at an economic meltdown that will be “sharper and more painful” than the 2008 financial crisis, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/03/20/us-economy-deteriorating-faster-than-anticipated-80-million-americans-forced-stay-home/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the WaPo</a></span><span>. Goldman Sachs estimates the economy will shrink at an annualized 24% rate over the next three months before picking up again.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span><span>Stocks are coming off their </span></span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/a9e625157c3e715b2811438b494eacff?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst week</a></span><span><span> since 2008, and last night futures hit their "limit down" level. But don’t ignore the chaos in </span></span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/nathanvardi/2020/03/20/the-credit-markets-terrible-week/#573858c63bab?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">credit markets</a></span><span><span>, which is where the Federal Reserve has directed most of its attention.</span></span><span>
</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/22/lawmakers-struggle-reach-consensus-rescue-package?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lawmakers Disagree to Disagree Over Stimulus Package
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, Secretary of Treasury Steven Mnuchin, and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer hold a meeting" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDEvc2VuYXRlX2RlbGliZXJhdGlvbnMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SAUL LOEB/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re guessing D.C.’s pizza delivery biz is doing okay. U.S. lawmakers <a href="https://apnews.com/9aeebd670bd0bc320ae6cebd1c17ddf3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spent the weekend</a> negotiating over an economic stimulus bill that may wrap a $1+ trillion <span>gauze pad </span>over an economy that's bleeding profusely. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s still in flux. After a summit of top congressional leaders yesterday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she wouldn’t support a bill the Senate had drafted. Then, the same bill failed a procedural vote in the Senate. Don't draft these folks for your escape room team. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what are the sticking points? </h2>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Corporate infusions. </strong></span><span>Democrats reportedly balked at </span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/22/coronavirus-stimulus-congress-141360?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$500 billion earmarked for corporations</a></span><span>, including $58 billion just for airlines. They called it a “slush fund” because the Treasury Department would determine who received support. And...Dems also thought the bill didn’t do enough to restrict companies that received federal aid from buying back stock. President Trump </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/president-trump-joins-democrats-in-calls-to-block-share-buybacks-11584876823?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agrees with that</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Exec knuckle raps</strong></span><span>. The bill would have imposed executive pay caps that lasted two years, which wasn't long enough for the c-suite hawks.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Jobless aid. </strong></span><span><span>Republicans offered three months of unemployment insurance—not long enough for Dems, who want to spend $250 billion expanding that safety net.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Healthcare.</strong></span><span><span> Pelosi and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer are advocating for an additional $200 billion for hospitals and other providers. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Student debt. </strong></span><span><span>Pelosi is reportedly trying to erase $10,000 in loans for anyone with federal student debt. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Loans for small businesses.</strong></span><span> The bill included $350 billion in small business loans that would be forgiven as long as the firms used them to retain staff. While that's pretty popular, Democrats objected because certain nonprofits would not be eligible. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Small businesses, workers stuck without incomes, and high-powered traders are all watching the details of this package closely. How it develops over the next few days will chart the U.S. economy’s path forward.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/22/initial-analysis-shows-major-economic-slowdown-across-sectors?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Global Economy Enters Sleep Mode
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="World turtle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNjMvd29ybGRfdHVydGxlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Calculating the economic damage from the coronavirus is not something we recommend, as it is both 1) depressing and 2) a waste of time considering there’s a lot we don’t know yet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While we wait for the official economic stats to arrive, the <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/d184fa0a-6904-11ea-800d-da70cff6e4d3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Financial Times</a> put together an unofficial “first glimpse” at the impact on business activity. The tl;dr: There is very little business activity.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Global restaurant demand has “ground to a halt”</strong></span><span> and so have brick-and-mortar retail sales. Foot traffic in the U.S. and Italy dropped more than 70% annually on March 18 (Springboard). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> Public entertainment has ceased to exist. </strong></span><span>In most of the countries where data was available, movie theater bookings dropped by more than 66% on the weekend of March 15. China and Italy reported “no data” that weekend (Box Office Mojo). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> The travel industry is fighting for survival. </strong></span><span>Last week, global flights were down over 20% month-over-month while road traffic has also dipped in major cities (Flightradar24). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Energy consumption</strong></span><span>, a proxy for economic activity, is significantly lower across Europe and China (the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity).</span>
</li>
</ol>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/22/latest-global-effects-coronavirus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Around the World
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Queen Victoria in a mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTcvcXVlZW5fdmljdG9yaWFfaW5fYV9tYXNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Anthony Devlin/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Australia: </strong>All nonessential businesses are <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-51992357?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shutting down</a> as cases grow into the thousands. Yes, even Bondi Beach. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">India: </strong>The government <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/cities-deserted-india-launches-curfew-stem-coronavirus-200322065155629.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">imposed a curfew</a> (called the "Janata Curfew") that requires people to quarantine themselves from 7am to 9pm. India has over 1.3 billion people and a severely strained healthcare system.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Germany: </strong>Chancellor Angela Merkel, who is quarantined after meeting with an infected doctor, <a href="https://www.dw.com/en/coronavirus-latest-angela-merkel-to-quarantine-after-meeting-infected-doctor/a-52874174?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned all meetings</a> of more than two people. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spain: </strong>After a spike in deaths on Sunday, the country now has the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-spain-tally/spains-coronavirus-deaths-surpass-1700-cases-over-28000-health-ministry-idUSKBN2190G7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second-worst outbreak</a> in Europe after Italy.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">U.K.: </strong>The government said it would pay <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/uk-to-pay-up-to-80-of-wages-in-economic-fightback-against-coronavirus-as-pubs-forced-to-close-2020-03-20?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up to 80%</a> of furloughed workers’ salaries. PM Boris Johnson also ordered pubs, restaurants, theaters, and more to close.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Italy: </strong><a href="https://www.telegraph.co.uk/global-health/science-and-disease/fear-have-almost-lost-control-doctors-nurses-account-8-italys/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Doctors and nurses</a> account for more than 8% of total coronavirus cases in the country. All nonessential factories were ordered to close on Saturday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hong Kong: </strong>The financial secretary said its economy “is in <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-22/hong-kong-s-economy-is-in-deep-water-finance-chief-says?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deep water</a>.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Israel: </strong>The government has tapped the country’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/israel-turns-to-its-spy-agencies-to-combat-coronavirus-11584735025?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">famous intelligence agencies</a> to help with the outbreak. Israelis cannot leave their homes outside of grocery shopping, medical treatment, or trips to the pharmacy. </p>

</td>

<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Dancing in living room" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/298/dancing.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the coronavirus quarantine drags on, we’re all getting hungry for human interaction. You could start asking the AT&T customer service rep about her day...or you could join a star-studded virtual dance party. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the past several days, DJ D-Nice has been <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/21/arts/d-nice-instagram.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making that happen</a>. The LA-based DJ has been throwing a series of parties on Instagram Live he's calling "Homeschool." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Saturday night's party would have filled Madison Square Garden five times over. More than 100,000 viewers joined, including Rihanna, Justin Timberlake, Ellen DeGeneres, and even Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>D-Nice told the NYT he missed the energy of a crowd after gigs at SXSW and Coachella were nixed. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Users said they really felt like they were popping bottles with celebrities. Either cabin fever is getting to us or it was a pretty great party. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> The coronavirus pandemic is rehabbing social media companies’ reputations from data-guzzling monopolists to humanity's only connection to social events. Instagram Live viewership in Italy has doubled in the last two weeks, according to an Instagram spokesperson.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>New home sales; G7 Foreign Ministers Meeting begins via video teleconference; Nike earnings </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Presumably a lot of stuff that was canceled </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Initial weekly unemployment claims; final Q4 GDP estimate; Lululemon earnings; would have been Opening Day for MLB <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/loudly-crying-face_1f62d.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Consumer sentiment; PCE price index inflation data; new Pearl Jam album </p>

</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/google/241/bento-box_1f371.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Lunch break, but make it productive</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Level up: </strong></span><span>Definitely worth poking around YouTube’s </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtFRv9O2AHqOZjjynzrv-xg?utm_campaign=Recomendo&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue+newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">learning hub</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Do good: </strong></span><span>We </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/20/ways-help-coronavirus-epidemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made a list</a></span><span> of the different ways you can donate your time and money to help those most affected.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stay up-to-date: </strong></span><span>NYC put out a </span><span><a href="https://www1.nyc.gov/assets/doh/downloads/pdf/imm/covid-sex-guidance.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guide to safe sex</a></span><span> in the age of coronavirus. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Dinner plans</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can’t go wrong with one-pot <a href="https://www.today.com/recipes/one-pot-mexican-rice-black-beans-corn-t47411?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mexican rice, beans, and corn</a>. While that cooks, read the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rice_and_beans?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rice and beans</a> Wikipedia page. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Evening activities</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen: </strong>Do a jigsaw puzzle. And by “do” we mean “start.” They take awhile...that’s kind of the point. Here’s a list of <a href="https://nymag.com/strategist/article/best-puzzles-reviews.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">21 puzzles</a> for you to begin your puzzle journey.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen: </strong>Morning Brew writer Eliza Carter watches a lot of TV—but absolutely no sports. So she’s exactly the type of person we need to turn to right now. Read Eliza’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/22/guide-nonsports-tv-sports-fans-someone-whos-never-watched-sports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">epic guide to non-sports TV from someone who’s never watched sports</a>.</p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_032020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

Goldman Sachs estimates the economy will shrink at an annualized 24% rate over the next three months before picking up again.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStocks are coming off their \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/a9e625157c3e715b2811438b494eacff?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworst week\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since 2008, and last night futures hit their \"limit down\" level. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re guessing D.C.’s pizza delivery biz is doing okay. U.S. lawmakers \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/9aeebd670bd0bc320ae6cebd1c17ddf3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espent the weekend\u003c/a\u003e negotiating over an economic stimulus bill that may wrap a $1+ trillion \u003cspan\u003egauze pad \u003c/span\u003eover an economy that's bleeding profusely. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s still in flux. After a summit of top congressional leaders yesterday, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced she wouldn’t support a bill the Senate had drafted. Then, the same bill failed a procedural vote in the Senate. Don't draft these folks for your escape room team. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what are the sticking points? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCorporate infusions. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDemocrats reportedly balked at \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/22/coronavirus-stimulus-congress-141360?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$500 billion earmarked for corporations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, including $58 billion just for airlines. They called it a “slush fund” because the Treasury Department would determine who received support. And...Dems also thought the bill didn’t do enough to restrict companies that received federal aid from buying back stock. President Trump \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/president-trump-joins-democrats-in-calls-to-block-share-buybacks-11584876823?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagrees with that\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eExec knuckle raps\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. The bill would have imposed executive pay caps that lasted two years, which wasn't long enough for the c-suite hawks.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJobless aid. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRepublicans offered three months of unemployment insurance—not long enough for Dems, who want to spend $250 billion expanding that safety net.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHealthcare.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Pelosi and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer are advocating for an additional $200 billion for hospitals and other providers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStudent debt. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePelosi is reportedly trying to erase $10,000 in loans for anyone with federal student debt. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLoans for small businesses.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The bill included $350 billion in small business loans that would be forgiven as long as the firms used them to retain staff. While that's pretty popular, Democrats objected because certain nonprofits would not be eligible. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Small businesses, workers stuck without incomes, and high-powered traders are all watching the details of this package closely. How it develops over the next few days will chart the U.S. economy’s path forward.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalculating the economic damage from the coronavirus is not something we recommend, as it is both 1) depressing and 2) a waste of time considering there’s a lot we don’t know yet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile we wait for the official economic stats to arrive, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/d184fa0a-6904-11ea-800d-da70cff6e4d3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFinancial Times\u003c/a\u003e put together an unofficial “first glimpse” at the impact on business activity. The tl;dr: There is very little business activity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e Global restaurant demand has “ground to a halt”\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and so have brick-and-mortar retail sales. Foot traffic in the U.S. and Italy dropped more than 70% annually on March 18 (Springboard). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e Public entertainment has ceased to exist. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn most of the countries where data was available, movie theater bookings dropped by more than 66% on the weekend of March 15. China and Italy reported “no data” that weekend (Box Office Mojo). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e The travel industry is fighting for survival. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast week, global flights were down over 20% month-over-month while road traffic has also dipped in major cities (Flightradar24). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnergy consumption\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a proxy for economic activity, is significantly lower across Europe and China (the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAustralia: \u003c/strong\u003eAll nonessential businesses are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-australia-51992357?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshutting down\u003c/a\u003e as cases grow into the thousands. Yes, even Bondi Beach. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIndia: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government \u003ca href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/cities-deserted-india-launches-curfew-stem-coronavirus-200322065155629.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimposed a curfew\u003c/a\u003e (called the \"Janata Curfew\") that requires people to quarantine themselves from 7am to 9pm. India has over 1.3 billion people and a severely strained healthcare system.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGermany: \u003c/strong\u003eChancellor Angela Merkel, who is quarantined after meeting with an infected doctor, \u003ca href=\"https://www.dw.com/en/coronavirus-latest-angela-merkel-to-quarantine-after-meeting-infected-doctor/a-52874174?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned all meetings\u003c/a\u003e of more than two people. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpain: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter a spike in deaths on Sunday, the country now has the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-spain-tally/spains-coronavirus-deaths-surpass-1700-cases-over-28000-health-ministry-idUSKBN2190G7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecond-worst outbreak\u003c/a\u003e in Europe after Italy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.K.: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government said it would pay \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/uk-to-pay-up-to-80-of-wages-in-economic-fightback-against-coronavirus-as-pubs-forced-to-close-2020-03-20?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup to 80%\u003c/a\u003e of furloughed workers’ salaries. PM Boris Johnson also ordered pubs, restaurants, theaters, and more to close.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eItaly: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/global-health/science-and-disease/fear-have-almost-lost-control-doctors-nurses-account-8-italys/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDoctors and nurses\u003c/a\u003e account for more than 8% of total coronavirus cases in the country. All nonessential factories were ordered to close on Saturday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHong Kong: \u003c/strong\u003eThe financial secretary said its economy “is in \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-22/hong-kong-s-economy-is-in-deep-water-finance-chief-says?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeep water\u003c/a\u003e.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIsrael: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government has tapped the country’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/israel-turns-to-its-spy-agencies-to-combat-coronavirus-11584735025?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efamous intelligence agencies\u003c/a\u003e to help with the outbreak. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the coronavirus quarantine drags on, we’re all getting hungry for human interaction. You could start asking the AT\u0026T customer service rep about her day...or you could join a star-studded virtual dance party. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the past several days, DJ D-Nice has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/21/arts/d-nice-instagram.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emaking that happen\u003c/a\u003e. The LA-based DJ has been throwing a series of parties on Instagram Live he's calling \"Homeschool.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSaturday night's party would have filled Madison Square Garden five times over. More than 100,000 viewers joined, including Rihanna, Justin Timberlake, Ellen DeGeneres, and even Joe Biden and Bernie Sanders.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eD-Nice told the NYT he missed the energy of a crowd after gigs at SXSW and Coachella were nixed. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUsers said they really felt like they were popping bottles with celebrities. Either cabin fever is getting to us or it was a pretty great party. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e The coronavirus pandemic is rehabbing social media companies’ reputations from data-guzzling monopolists to humanity's only connection to social events.
